Posts.Content: Hi Dawne, I know everyone is different, but if it helps any here are my "two cents"! I am a natural born redhead, with pale slightly freckly skin. I figured that I would be toast! I had 35 treatments including four "boost" treatments. My skin got real pink and sort of dry (like a regular sunburn). But no blisters, no open skin, and the pinkness went away after I stopped (about two weeks later). I used aquaphor, too. Best of luck! Hope you breeze on through it all! REST! Sybil
Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: Hi, so sorry that happened to you. I had an anaphylactic reaction to taxotere on my second treatment (of four). Throat closed up, could not breathe, rash, back and side pain. I got similar treatment, IV benadryl, IV solumedrol, etc. Then after some plain IV fluids, they restarted at a super slow rate. I had to take my other two treatments at a slower rate, but was able to tolerate the last two. That was so scary! Best wishes to you on your continued treatments... Sybil
Posts.Title: allergic to taxotere

Posts.Content: Susan, I am so sorry about this news. I am glad that your medical team is moving quickly to take action...Prayers, hugs, and positive vibes to you, Sybil

Posts.Content: Hi Nancy, Thinking of you and sending good thoughts as you begin your new treatment regimen... Hugs! Sybil

Posts.Content: I am so sorry that you are having to go through this. Nobody deserves this type of treatment. Confront him. Make copies of whatever you have as far as emails. He will try to deny it, or say that you are paranoid or something. Have evidence. You are worth better treatment than this and you did not cause this. LOVE AND HUGS, Sybil

Posts.Title: Char

Posts.Title: Wish me luck! Here I go with the new chemo drug!

Posts.Content: Hi, I had lumpectomies, chemo, radiation, and have now been taking Femara (similar to aromisin) for one year. The side effects are not the easiest--bone pain, fatigue, sometimes insomnia, hot flashes, but I have made it through so far. I have thought of stopping the drug early on, but I am sort of adjusting... Best wishes as you make your decision, Sybil
Posts.Title: Aromasin after Chemo and Radiation

Posts.Content: I counted down the days...but still felt a little lost when I got my diploma, and finished rads. I had taken the whole day off from work that time. I went out and walked around the mall. I decided to buy myself a keepsake to commemorate the day. I walked into one store and there was a pink pillow with the pink breast cancer ribbon and the word "Survivor". I bought that pillow and display it in my office at work. Although, I still wondered if I would be one (a survivor)...that was a year and a half ago...so far so good... Sybil
Posts.Title: Having a really hard time...

Posts.Content: Cynthia, you are so interesting! I love reading your posts... What a sweet pet story! Thanks for the story, Sybil
